title: Chronic and Communicable Disease Prevention
description: Significant chronic and communicable diseases including disparities among population groups in the U.S. Social, ecological, behavioral and lifestyle factors. Primary, secondary and tertiary prevention strategies that promote health, prevent disease and improve quality of life. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: KINE 250, KINE 255, or KINE 260, and BIO 111 or BIO 161
